alert.note: Alert for Black Hills and Southwest Interior Lowlands; Central Coastal Lowlands; North Coastal Lowlands (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 14 at 11:18AM PDT until August 14 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR HOT, DRY AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 650, 651, AND 655... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 650 North Coastal Lowlands, Fire Weather Zone 651 Central Coastal Lowlands and Fire Weather Zone 655 Black Hills and Southwest Interior Lowlands. * WINDS...North 5 to 10 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 20 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the upper 80s to 90s. * WINDS...Increasing north winds 10 to 12 mph with gusts to 15 mph for portions of these zones. * HAINES...Mid-level Haines 6 or high potential for large plume dominated fire growth. * IMPACTS...A dry and unstable air mass with warm temperatures can contribute to active fire behavior. In western Washington, significant growth on existing fires takes place under such conditions. If a fire were to begin, air quality may diminish in the surrounding area.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either imminent or occurring now. Any fires that develop will likely spread quickly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.

area.areaDesc: Black Hills and Southwest Interior Lowlands; Central Coastal Lowlands; North Coastal Lowlands
